title: Should summoners only get to use level 7 champs in ranked?
body:
This has probably already been brought up before, but how come anyone can use any champs etc that they haven't proven they  are good with yet. I know there many flaws to this argument, but wouldn't it be be better having a summoner playing a champ they know how to play? 
Also it might be better at low elo vs high I guess. It would also work better imo when a troll pick is happening.

Your thoughts?

replies.body:
Have you tried getting lvl 7 recently? 
They don't exactly fall into your hands. And even if they did, you have to pay more than the champ itself to actually unlock it.

I chase lvl 7's more than most people _(well... I used to.. before they became ludicrously expense)_. I have 12 total, thats the entire accumulation of the whole time it has been live. That gives me _just_ over **half** the number of champs you need to play ranked. Not to mention 6 of them are mid laners _(and likely the next one will also be a mid laner)_, which leaves me with pretty much 1 champ per other position.
So if i get support, and Taric is banned, what should I do? Play Kindred support? I think that'd probably be worse than having a first time champ.

I see where you are coming from, no one likes that 1 guy that picks the new champ, or the champ that wrecked him last game, and has no idea what to do, but to play ranked properly you really need **minimum**  3 champs per position, thats 15 lvl 7's total. which isn't even enough to play ranked anyway.

Agreed, perhaps you should have a requirement of a couple of games played with a champ before playing them in ranked. But lvl 7 _(or even 5)_ is too ambitious I think.

yeah, also it can take different people different amounts of time to get mastery 7 on some champions. For example I got M7 on Zilean and Janna about 7 games after I got mastery 5, but I only recently went about getting my M7 on my main Shaco after looking at my mastery points, seeing I had 300k and realising I had to get M7 or it'd look embarrassing. So I queued with 2 bronze friends and just stomped.

Some players have very team oriented habits, like gifting kills to lanes that could leverage a lead, throwing their champion into the way of an oncoming skillshot to ensure their team doesn't lose a resulting teamfight. Not taking cs as a support or tank lategame, spending gold on control wards. But these habits are not helpful when you're trying to get an S. As a jungler, you could help protect your botlane from ganks for a price of 300g worth of control wards, but you could also just save the gold and get a duskblade just a little faster. The wards would probably better increase your winrate, but the duskblade earlier will make your score better, and make it look more like you're solo carrying.

The higher mastery level = better, mentality is really encouraging some bad habits.

Thats all well and good, but what i was meaning was, in order to play ranked you should have your champ at M7. This is more intended for the low elo group. As you hear on occasion 'Im playing a new champ iv only played twice'. At low elo everyone usually is selfish and doing that kind of stuff to help out the team is highly rare. So if they had champs they had proven they can play, then it might help the enjoyment overall for everyone....maybe.

there are champs I have at mastery lvl6 that I am more competent on, than mastery lvl 7 champions.
